steps.description: Initialize array: [64, 25, 12, 22, 11]. Selection Sort finds the minimum element and puts it in the correct place.
Find the minimum in the unsorted part. Start by comparing 64 and 25. Current minimum is 25.
Compare current minimum (25) with 12. New minimum is 12.
Compare current minimum (12) with 22. Minimum is still 12.
Compare current minimum (12) with 11. New minimum is 11 (at index 4).
Swap the minimum element (11) with the first unsorted element (64). The first element is now sorted.
Find the minimum in the remaining unsorted part. Compare 25 and 12. Current minimum is 12.
Compare current minimum (12) with 22. Minimum is still 12.
Compare current minimum (12) with 64. Minimum is still 12 (at index 2).
Swap the minimum (12) with the first unsorted element (25). First two elements are now sorted.
Find minimum in the rest. Compare 25 and 22. New minimum is 22.
Compare current minimum (22) with 64. Minimum is still 22.
Swap the minimum (22) with the first unsorted element (25).
Find minimum in the final unsorted part. Compare 25 and 64. No swap needed.
Sorting complete. The array is now fully sorted.
